image.altText: a middle-aged male police officer in uniform outdoors

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's police commissioner has delivered an apology to First Nations people and pledged to "eliminate racism" within the force during a speech at Garma Festival.Â

title.children: 'I am deeply sorry': NT Police commissioner makes apology to Indigenous people at Garma

image.altText: A gold sedan bogged in a snow bank, with a police vehicle behind it in the dark.

props.synopsis: ACT Policing Rural Patrol Senior Constable Angus Fergusson says when heading into cold conditions people should wear appropriate clothing, bring food and water, let someone know where you're going, and carry navigation equipment and a personal locator beacon.

title.children: Emergency services agencies urge weather preparedness after three Canberra region bush rescues in a month

image.altText: GettyImages-2164679482

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus pushes Katie Ledecky all the way in a classic 800m final, after Australia earlier secured more gold via the men's tennis doubles. Follow live.

title.children: Titmus claims 800m silver as American champ Ledecky adds to her Olympic legend

image.altText: a person holding a rainbow flag

props.synopsis: It is a threat many in the queer community thought was subsiding, albeit slowly, but recent events show that the danger of homophobic violence in Australia is proving to be even more pernicious.

title.children: Despite significant progress the threat of homophobic violence lingers stubbornly in Australia

image.altText: An Aboriginal flag blows in the wind, with bushes and pink flowers in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The ACT government proudly labels itself as progressive and was the only jurisdiction in Australia to vote for the Voice to Parliament in the referendum. So, how does Australia's capital fare when graded on the quality of life of its First Nations people?Â

title.children: 'We need to change the way we do business': First Nations youth incarceration rate rises

image.altText: People lying inside saunas floating on a lake.

props.synopsis: Visitors and locals could soon be jumping into the icy cold waters of Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin from two floating saunas. Detailed designs and plans have been released for feedback, with hopes to have them operational by summer.

title.children: Floating sauna on Lake Burley Griffin to heat things up in Canberra

image.altText: Matthew Ebden and John Peers hold Australian flags above their heads on court after winning Paris Olympics double gold medal.

props.synopsis: Matthew Ebden's Paris Olympics campaign started with a 6-0, 6-1 loss against Novak Djokovic, and ends with Australia's second-ever tennis gold medal alongside John Peers in the men's doubles.

title.children: Aussie doubles veterans come from behind to win gold in tense, triple-breaker final

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiling and a man with blond hair and pursed lips

props.synopsis: The Harris campaign said Mr Trump was trying to back out of a debate that had been set to run on a rival network.

title.children: Harris, Trump disagree on presidential debate, as Trump proposes Fox News event

image.altText: A small child dancing in the sand with adults watching in the background.

props.synopsis: Amid shifting sands in Indigenous affairs, young leaders are drawing strength from their culture to stand firm.

title.children: Young leaders growing in stature as sands shift in Indigenous leadership

image.altText: An excavator sinking into mud at a mine.  A large dozer is being used to drag it out.

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old was working at the Byerwen surface coal mine this morning near Glenden in the Bowen Basin, about 200 kilometres west of Mackay.Â

title.children: Worker dead after accident at coal mine in north Queensland

image.altText: A man celebrates after winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: It's been a long time between drinks in Victoria for St George Illawarra but a mighty display from Ben Hunt propelled the Dragons to their first win in Melbourne since 1999.

title.children: Dragons shake off 25-year hoodoo in shock win over Melbourne

image.altText: A painting of a bearded man on wood.

props.synopsis: ABC Radio Brisbane asked its listeners to enter portraits of Costa Georgiadis for this year's Bradley. There were so many masterpieces he was relieved he wasn't a judge.

title.children: We asked you to capture Costa's bearded beauty â and here are our favourite artworks

image.altText: Pool (1)

props.synopsis: In 2020, three childcare workers took six children on their weekly excursion to the pool â but only five made it home. A five-day inquest has probed how one toddler was left behind at a public swimming pool.

title.children: Alone and locked in a public pool, Kumanjayi drowned in minutes. His family wants answers

image.altText: croweater on hill

props.synopsis: Australia joins the list of worldwide locations where Active Clubs have been established. Experts say white supremacy groups like this are a threat to our social cohesion.Â

title.children: Not sports clubs: 'Active Clubs' are threatening social cohesion in Australia, expert says

image.altText: Sydney Swans players walk off the ground after a loss

props.synopsis: Sydney coach John Longmire was not a happy camper after seeing his side slump to its heaviest loss in his 13-year tenure in charge. Meanwhile, Mitch McGovern's miss after the siren allowed Collingwood to escape with a win in Scott Pendlebury's 400th match.

title.children: 'Utterly unacceptable' Swans blasted after 112-point loss, Pies win thriller after Blues star's post-siren miss

image.altText: A man stands in a glass box as people take photos of him.

props.synopsis: One of the largest and most complex prisoner swaps since the Cold War was almost derailed by a shocking death, competing global agendas, and a US president's fading political ambitions.Â

title.children: A painstaking, top-secret prisoner swap was almost done. Then came a mysterious death

image.altText: Anna at her gate close crop

props.synopsis: Anna reached adulthood believing she was an orphan. Then the truth came out.

title.children: 'I believe I was human trafficked': this Melbourne woman discovered her history was a lie

image.altText: Police station shot up in flames

props.synopsis: Protesters attack police and start fires in Sunderland as violence spreads to another English city following a stabbing attack in Southport that left three children dead.

title.children: Protests turn violent in England as unrest spreads after Southport killings

image.altText: A composite image of a man in a puffer jacket, skiers, and a foot in socks over a fire

props.synopsis: The word on the street seems unanimous â it feels like one of the coldest winters in living memory.

title.children: Australia shivers through June and July, so was the BOM's forecast of a warm winter wrong?

image.altText: A man with a white shirt

props.synopsis: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin has revoked a plea deal agreed to earlier this week with the man accused of being the chief architect of the September 11 attacks, Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, and two of his accomplices, reinstating them as death penalty cases.

title.children: Pentagon chief revokes plea deal with three September 11 attack suspects, reinstating them as death penalty cases

image.altText: A white hatchback with five holes in its windscreen.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives are investigating the fatal shooting of a man at Burnside Heights, in Melbourne's north-west on Friday night.

title.children: Police investigate fatal shooting in Melbourne's north-west

image.altText: A young Yazidi woman holds up a photograph of herself and her older brother carrying a teddy bear and smiling.

props.synopsis: A decade after the Islamic State attempted to ethnically cleanse the Yazidi minority of northern Iraq, refugees in regional New South Wales struggle to rebuild their lives and preserve their culture.

title.children: Yazidi community's struggle to hold onto its culture 10 years after genocide at hands of ISIS

image.altText: People sit and lie on the floor of a military plane's cabin

props.synopsis: It's a war that has displaced 10 million, created famine and killed at least 18,760 people. Every member of the Sudanese diaspora in Australia has been affected by the carnage.

title.children: Five days in an apartment in darkness: How one Australian escaped Sudan's brutal civil war

image.altText: A woman delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris secures the delegate votes needed to clinch the Democratic US presidential nomination and become the first woman of colour at the top of a major party ticket.

title.children: Kamala Harris secures delegate votes needed to become Democratic nominee

image.altText: hands holding Australian cash notes

props.synopsis: New data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics shows household spending has fallen by 0.5 per cent for June after two consecutive rises.

title.children: Australians households are spending less. Here's what they're cutting back on

image.altText: A group of men throw peace signs for the camera

props.synopsis: Iran's Revolutionary Guards says revenge for the killing of the Hamas leader will be "severe".

title.children: Iran says Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was killed by short-range projectile

image.altText: Colourful tins, jars and boxes on a kitchen pantry shelf.

props.synopsis: You may be eating Australian-grown food that has been processed overseas and then shipped back again. Local food manufacturers worry they will struggle to compete with imports among price-conscious consumers.Â

title.children: Exporting fresh food and importing it back processed â is this the future of Australian food?

image.altText: Buildings in the backdrop, next to a Lebanese flag flying in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Australians in Lebanon say they've been left "stranded" trying to exit Lebanon amid renewed advice from the federal government to evacuate the country. But many say they've been left in the dark after being told the airport is closed.

title.children: 'Stranded' Australians holidaying in Lebanon say they can't get home amid evacuation orders

image.altText: A black sign with 'CFMEU Victoria' written on it, hanging on a construction site.

props.synopsis: Construction bosses and building industry whistleblowers fearful of retribution will be free to speak out against the CFMEU under cover of a potential parliamentary inquiry amid concern existing workplace regulators lack investigative teeth and protections.

title.children: Fair Work takeover of CFMEU 'not enough' say critics calling for greater witness protections

image.altText: The Eiffel Tower lit up with the beach volleyball stadium in the foreground and a sunset

props.synopsis: Paris 2024 has embraced its most famous landmark in the most spectacular way, giving rise to one of the most iconic of Olympic venues.

title.children: 'This is a spectacle': Athletes and celebs flock to one of the most iconic venues in Olympics history

image.altText: Large entrances and cut-outs open the home up to the garden outside.

props.synopsis: The home opens up into a lush backyard, providing relief from the Queensland heat while giving the feel of more room inside.

title.children: House of the Year winner proves bigger isn't always better, with room for family and work under one roof

image.altText: Saya Sakakibara holds her head and cries

props.synopsis: Saya Sakakibara has endured things as an athlete that many would ever recover from â but her Olympic gold medal is a testament to her strength, and that of her entire family.

title.children: The happy tears of Sakakibara's Olympic gold are a testament to her endurance in the face of adversity

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown holds her hands on her head and looks up after a race

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown's rare Olympic "double-double" means she stands alone in Australian swimming history, but even without the records she will be remembered as one of the sport's most unique champions.Â

title.children: Unique, resilient, legendary â Kaylee McKeown has taken Australian swimming into uncharted Olympic waters

image.altText: A tall blonde woman in a beige wrap dress surrounded by artworks: blue stacked totems and a brass wall hanging behind her

props.synopsis:
Clementine Stoney Maconachie made her Olympic debut in the pool at the Sydney 2000 Games. More than two decades later, she's in Paris as an Olympian Artist.

Â

title.children: Illness ended this Australian swimmer's career. Now she's at the Olympics as an artist

image.altText: Five girls standing in e-sports uniform.

props.synopsis: After almost 10 years of competing as a "part-time, non-sponsored, zero-budget" team, Grills Gaming shares what it is like to push forward in the male-dominated arena of esports.Â

title.children: 'Oh my God, you can't lose to her': What's stopping women from making it to the top ranks in esports?
